definitions.definition: Something that happens to someone by chance, a chance occurrence, especially a favourable one.
definitions.example: Gilbert had some bad luck yesterday â€” he got pick-pocketed and lost fifty dollars.

definitions.definition: A superstitious feeling that brings fortune or success.
definitions.example: He blew on the dice for luck.
He has a lot of luck with the ladies, perhaps it is because of his new motorbike.

definitions.definition: The results of a random number generator.
definitions.example: The creators of tool-assisted speedruns often manipulate a lot of luck to get the most favorable results in order to save the most time.
No plan. We're just to going to have to luck through.

definitions.definition: To carry out relying on luck.
definitions.example: Our plan is to luck it through.
